contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} The '''Lumpeninvestoriat''' is a term used by financial [[Pundit (politics)|pundit]]s, especially online but also in the printed press, as a reference to the masses of common investors. The word is combination of [[lumpenproletariat]] and [[investor]]. It is often applied by contrarian writers in a derogatory sense, with the implication that the masses of investors tend to blindly follow trends without regard to the underlying dynamics of the [[financial markets]], often with long-term disastrous results.
